subject: Ensure all filter items end with '='
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-08-17 09:29:32.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/instances/tables.py'], 'message': "Ensure all filter items end with '='

Previously some filters have '=' and some do not.
This commit ensures all filters have '='.

Only exception is 'Changed Since'. In this case, no '=' is correct
as it means '>='.

Change-Id: I0cb0e39ed80d2caf9509d4d2ec3e3e6957bf56f4
Closes-Bug: #1709882
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Ensure all filter items end with '='

Previously some filters have '=' and some do not.
This commit ensures all filters have '='.

Only exception is 'Changed Since'. In this case, no '=' is correct
as it means '>='.

Change-Id: I0cb0e39ed80d2caf9509d4d2ec3e3e6957bf56f4
Closes-Bug: #1709882

commit_message:
Fix error in zun create

This patch deletes "nargs=argparse.REMAINDER," from arg('command'),
to avoid the problem in Bug #1712493.

Change-Id: I86e9b1474d5a6dc2fbe8a9370c173871d7c941fd
Closes-Bug: #1712493

commit_message:
Fix panko port to match tht

In templates we use 13977 as the port for panko. The
old 13779 is reserved for trove so it conflicts.

Closes-bug: #1712566

Change-Id: I77444199eef6c2b9abbd819829b4fea2d698e2db

subject: Add /bin to PATH for CRL cronjob
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-08-24 06:27:41.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/certmonger/ca/crl.pp'], 'message': "Add /bin to PATH for CRL cronjob

Checking the root's mail (/var/mail/root) I finally saw the root cause
of the CRL cronjob not working.

/bin/sh: curl: command not found

now, curl, (and most commands used by that cronjob) is in the /bin bash,
so we need to add it to the environment's PATH for the cronjob.

Change-Id: If10855b801782eeaf2006cd57071d74d13daf8c2
Closes-Bug: #1712404
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Add /bin to PATH for CRL cronjob

Checking the root's mail (/var/mail/root) I finally saw the root cause
of the CRL cronjob not working.

/bin/sh: curl: command not found

now, curl, (and most commands used by that cronjob) is in the /bin bash,
so we need to add it to the environment's PATH for the cronjob.

Change-Id: If10855b801782eeaf2006cd57071d74d13daf8c2
Closes-Bug: #1712404

commit_message:
Switch to using Spark version 2.2.0

Following changes were required:

1.)
By default the pre-built distribution
for Spark 2.2.0 is compiled with Scala 2.11.
monasca-transform requires Spark compiled with
Scala 2.10 since we use spark streaming to
pull data from Kafka and the version of Kafka
is compatible with Scala 2.10.
The recommended way is to compile Spark
with Scala 2.10, but for purposes of devstack
plugin made changes to pull the required jars
from mvn directly.
(see SPARK_JARS and SPARK_JAVA_LIB variables in
settings)
All jars get moved to
<SPARK_HOME>/assembly/target/assembly/
target/scala_2.10/jars/
Note: <SPARK_HOME>/jars gets renamed
to <SPARK_HOME>/jars_original.
spark-submit defaults to assembly location
if <SPARK_HOME>/jars directory is missing.

2.) Updated start up scripts for spark
worker and spark master with a new env variable
SPARK_SCALA_VERSIOn=2.10. Also updated
PYTHONPATH variable to add new
py4j-0.10.4-src.zip file

3.) Some changes to adhere to deprecated pyspark
function calls which were removed in Spark 2.0

Change-Id: I8f8393bb91307d55f156b2ebf45225a16ae9d8f4

subject: Cleanup allocations in failed prep_resize
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-08-24 20:35:05.000000000', 'files': ['nova/scheduler/client/report.py', 'nova/compute/manager.py', 'nova/tests/functional/test_servers.py', 'nova/compute/resource_tracker.py'], 'message': "Cleanup allocations in failed prep_resize

During a resize/migration, the scheduler 'doubles' the
allocations on both the source and destination hosts, which
could be the same host if resizing to the same host.

If prep_resize fails, the destination node allocations were
not getting cleaned up before rescheduling to another host.
If it's a resize to the same host, the doubled allocation
from the scheduler wasn't being subtracted for the single host.

This change cleans up the allocations from the current node
when prep_resize fails. If it's not a resize to the same host,
we're on the destination node already. If it is a resize to
the same host, remove_provider_from_instance_allocation in the
SchedulerReportClient accounts for subtracting the new flavor
from the doubled allocation.

Change-Id: I8e81704518cef8847dc65b70a75cbd5e67f1cd39
Closes-Bug: #1712850
(cherry picked from commit b53133ba50457f1a4983434800ebef710da67999)
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Cleanup allocations in failed prep_resize

During a resize/migration, the scheduler 'doubles' the
allocations on both the source and destination hosts, which
could be the same host if resizing to the same host.

If prep_resize fails, the destination node allocations were
not getting cleaned up before rescheduling to another host.
If it's a resize to the same host, the doubled allocation
from the scheduler wasn't being subtracted for the single host.

This change cleans up the allocations from the current node
when prep_resize fails. If it's not a resize to the same host,
we're on the destination node already. If it is a resize to
the same host, remove_provider_from_instance_allocation in the
SchedulerReportClient accounts for subtracting the new flavor
from the doubled allocation.

Change-Id: I8e81704518cef8847dc65b70a75cbd5e67f1cd39
Closes-Bug: #1712850
(cherry picked from commit b53133ba50457f1a4983434800ebef710da67999)

subject: Make test_notifier independent of test case execution order
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-08-10 12:21:41.000000000', 'files': ['osprofiler/tests/unit/test_notifier.py'], 'message': "Make test_notifier independent of test case execution order

Test_notifier contains a test case that verifies default notifier value
(test_get_default_notifier) and there are 2 test cases that update
default notifier value. It's supposed that test_get_default_notifier
is executed first, otherwise it gets wrong value. Test's tearDown()
method was designed to restore default notifier, but failed to do so
due to wrong reference to global variable.

Change-Id: Id083f1e8ba4bf2a0341eb1a7ee8891b53c1f3a65
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Make test_notifier independent of test case execution order

Test_notifier contains a test case that verifies default notifier value
(test_get_default_notifier) and there are 2 test cases that update
default notifier value. It's supposed that test_get_default_notifier
is executed first, otherwise it gets wrong value. Test's tearDown()
method was designed to restore default notifier, but failed to do so
due to wrong reference to global variable.

Change-Id: Id083f1e8ba4bf2a0341eb1a7ee8891b53c1f3a65

commit_message:
Fix the undefined NetworkNotFound exception

In https://github.com/openstack/zun/blob/master/zun/network/neutron.py,
it raised NetworkNotFound, but this exception is undefined.
We need to define it in common/exception.py.

Change-Id: I94ba6d6241b8bd66632a896e85603edc666d69f5
Closes-Bug: #1712419
(cherry picked from commit 70be55086f39403504b2156c2fcbeb823f225ff3)

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-08-10 18:50:19.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': '[stormmore] Add show-disk-free action to ceph-mon charm

Added action show-disk-free that shows the output from ceph osd df
tree. This makes it easier to determine how balanced the data is

Bug: Issue 1709950
Change-Id: Idecb0fb5ee48b2a24a8991c64a9feeff1950f67b
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2017-08-24 22:39:31.000000000', 'files': ['actions/show-disk-free.py', 'actions/show-disk-free', 'actions.yaml'], 'message': 'Add show-disk-free action to ceph-mon charm

commit_message:
Add show-disk-free action to ceph-mon charm

Added action show-disk-free that shows the output from ceph osd df
tree. This makes it easier to determine how balanced the data is
spread over the OSDs.

Closes-Bug: #1709950

commit_message:
Restrict live migration to same cell

We do not yet support live migrating an instance
across cells. This change handles two cases for
live migration:

1. The destination host is forced so the scheduler
   is bypassed. In this case we directly compare the
   source cell against the destination cell and fail
   if they are not the same with a MigrationPreCheckError.

2. If no destination host is specified, or it's not forced,
   we update the RequestSpec sent to the scheduler so it
   will restrict the compute nodes it pulls from the same
   cell that the instance lives in. If a host is requested
   in this case but it's in a different cell, it would result
   in a NoValidHost error from the scheduler.

Change-Id: I66fc72d402ac118270a835cf929fe1ea387d78cd
Closes-Bug: #1712008

Remove rally_endpoint in api

We decide to add a service_layer, so we doesn't use the
rally_endpoint and api_wrapper.

Change-Id: Idfeb232d368830ebd9b98b7e0c649e26218d2a74

[{'created': '2017-08-21 22:39:27.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "WIP: Allocate resources on forced dest host during live migration

When forcing a host during live migration, conductor bypasses
the scheduler so the scheduler won't create an allocation in
Placement against the destination host.

With change Ia93168b1560267178059284186fb2b7096c7e81f, once all
computes are upgraded to Pike, the computes won't auto-heal the
allocations for their respective nodes either, so we end up no
allocation for the destination node during a live migration when
the host is forced.

This change makes conductor call the scheduler with the forced
host so that the allocations are made for the instance on the
destination node in Placement. This is shown by the changes to

easy to get lost on what the API is doing to the request spec which
changes how conductor behaves, i.e. if it calls the scheduler or not.

commit_message:
Allocate resources on forced dest host during live migration

When forcing a host during live migration, conductor bypasses
the scheduler so the scheduler won't create an allocation in
Placement against the destination host.

With change Ia93168b1560267178059284186fb2b7096c7e81f, once all
computes are upgraded to Pike, the computes won't auto-heal the
allocations for their respective nodes either, so we end up with
no allocation for the destination node during a live migration when
the host is forced.

This change makes conductor use the source compute node allocations
for the instance to claim the same resource amounts on the forced
destination host in Placement. If the claim fails, a
MigrationPreCheckError is raised.

This is a short-term fix for Pike. A longer-term fix to avoid this
duplication with the scheduler is to have conductor call the
scheduler even when force=True but pass a flag to the scheduler
so it skips the filters but still makes the claim on the destination
node.

Finally, some comments are left in the live_migrate method in the
compute API code since this is all tightly-coupled between the
API and conductor when a host is specified in the request, and it's
easy to get lost on what the API is doing to the request spec which
changes how conductor behaves, i.e. if it calls the scheduler or not.

Change-Id: I40b5af5e85b1266402a7e4bdeb3705e1b0bd6f3b
Closes-Bug: #1712008

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-08-24 19:35:27.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Cleanup allocations in failed prep_resize

During a resize/migration, the scheduler 'doubles' the
allocations on both the source and destination hosts, which
could be the same host if resizing to the same host.

If prep_resize fails, the destination node allocations were
not getting cleaned up before rescheduling to another host.
If it's a resize to the same host, the doubled allocation
from the scheduler wasn't being subtracted for the single host.

This change cleans up the allocations from the current node
when prep_resize fails. If it's not a resize to the same host,
we're on the destination node already. If it is a resize to
the same host, remove_provider_from_instance_allocation in the
SchedulerReportClient accounts for subtracting the new flavor
from the doubled allocation.

Change-Id: I8e81704518cef8847dc65b70a75cbd5e67f1cd39
Closes-Bug: #1712850

commit_message:
Cleanup allocations in failed prep_resize

During a resize/migration, the scheduler 'doubles' the
allocations on both the source and destination hosts, which
could be the same host if resizing to the same host.

If prep_resize fails, the destination node allocations were
not getting cleaned up before rescheduling to another host.
If it's a resize to the same host, the doubled allocation
from the scheduler wasn't being subtracted for the single host.

This change cleans up the allocations from the current node
when prep_resize fails. If it's not a resize to the same host,
we're on the destination node already. If it is a resize to
the same host, remove_provider_from_instance_allocation in the
SchedulerReportClient accounts for subtracting the new flavor
from the doubled allocation.

Change-Id: I8e81704518cef8847dc65b70a75cbd5e67f1cd39
Closes-Bug: #1712850

commit_message:
Remove source node allocation after live migration completes

This is done in a similar way to evacuation and shelve offload
to avoid further mingling of new-style allocation management
code with existing resource tracker code (soon to be removed).

Closes-Bug: #1712045
Change-Id: I6afd69166704e45d983b8b06a32a2799fb82b58a

commit_message:
Add functional test for rescheduling during a migration

This adds a functional test which recreates the bug where
the allocations on a destination node are not removed from
Placement before rescheduling during a cold migrate operation,
which is the same code flow as a resize even though resize
isn't explicitly tested here.

Change-Id: I1e3def1e98d0008240837eb1ad0eaa81a9b2d189
Related-Bug: #1712850
(cherry picked from commit 78850296a54ff2e1ec298c013fa91fc6eace962b)

commit_message:
Remove allocation when booting instance rescheduled or aborted

In Pike release, there is no auto-heal in the resource tracker.
So when instance booting failed, the allocation records aren't
cleaned up.

This patch clean up the allocation records when the instance
rescheduled and aborted.

Change-Id: I95d2f4c9392883052188fb7901451530068502db
Closes-Bug: #1712718
(cherry picked from commit c19ebcbd58bc673e336bc5fa3b815c7b0a20d628)

commit_message:
Fix sample configuration generation for compute-related options

Currently the compute_opts are duplicated in both [DEFAULT] and [compute]
sections, while compute_group_opts are missing at all.

This patch does not affect where the options actually are, only where
they are displayed in the sample configuration.

Closes-Bug: #1712855

Change-Id: I68f246998fd68e669b0d9ef34b00ed384f4f0c90
(cherry picked from commit 64cb56c81a7309a667eea2ce85147e62d02cac91)

commit_message:
image-create-via-import fails with ValueError

CLI image-create-via-import fails with ValueError. The reason
is create command returns RequestIdWrapper object and not image
and response.

Further it fails with AttributeError: 'Namespace' object has
no attribute 'import_method'. The reason is do_import_image() call
requires 'import_method' as input which is not provided at the
moment.

Change-Id: Ic4c4d1f3c5d290b584840e8f9047fb53611a5748
Closes-bug: #1711511
(cherry picked from commit 335f1e944719023a887730a223353a4bdb209815)

subject: Migrate openvswitch-switch file to avoid restarts
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-08-23 02:31:14.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Avoid unnecessary service restarts

Commit 4463c334 introduced a restart_trigger option allowing
remote services to trigger restarts of various services provided
by the neutron-openvswitch charm. This seemingly innocuous change
alters the openvswitch-switch template to add restart_trigger to
the file header, which changes the contents of the file and causes
a restart of the openvswitch-switch service. This restart causes
a disruption to the data plane.

This change introduces logic into the RemoteRestartContext that
determines whether openvswitch-switch config file needs to include
the restart_trigger section. This is done in a way that the charm
will avoid altering the contents of the openvswitch-switch file
unless a configuration change has actually been requested, or a
remote application requests a restart.

Change-Id: Icc0f326991be239b88a57292740473f501181ebb
Closes-Bug: #1712444
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2017-08-23 22:38:03.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Migrate openvswitch-switch file to avoid restarts

The 16.10 release of the neutron-openvswitch charm changed the
file management strategy of /etc/default/openvswitch-switch
config file from managing the file when dpdk is enabled to always
managing the file. Additionally, the template file was changed
in the 16.10 release to modify the file header (commit 4463c334).
These two changes guarantee that the contents of the file will
change when upgrading the charm.

The changing file contents causes the openvswitch-switch service
to be restarted, which in turn causes a data plane outage. This
commit fixes that by migrating the /etc/default/openvswitch-switch
to be charm managed without restarting the openvswitch-switch
service.

The change will only attempt to migrate versions of the file
which were created before 16.10 by searching for a marker in the
rendered version of the file which was added in 16.10.

Change-Id: Icc0f326991be239b88a57292740473f501181ebb
Closes-Bug: #1712444
', 'number': 2}, {'created': '2017-08-23 22:39:44.000000000', 'files': ['unit_tests/16.07-dpdk-openvswitch-switch', 'unit_tests/16.10-openvswitch-switch', 'unit_tests/test_neutron_ovs_hooks.py', 'hooks/neutron_ovs_hooks.py', 'unit_tests/package-provided-openvswitch-switch'], 'message': 'Migrate openvswitch-switch file to avoid restarts

The 16.10 release of the neutron-openvswitch charm changed the
file management strategy of /etc/default/openvswitch-switch
config file from managing the file when dpdk is enabled to always
managing the file. Additionally, the template file was changed
in the 16.10 release to modify the file header (commit 4463c334).
These two changes guarantee that the contents of the file will
change when upgrading the charm.

The changing file contents causes the openvswitch-switch service
to be restarted, which in turn causes a data plane outage. This
commit fixes that by migrating the /etc/default/openvswitch-switch
to be charm managed without restarting the openvswitch-switch
service.

The change will only attempt to migrate versions of the file
which were created before 16.10 by searching for a marker in the
rendered version of the file which was added in 16.10.

Change-Id: Icc0f326991be239b88a57292740473f501181ebb
Closes-Bug: #1712444
', 'number': 3}]
commit_message:
Migrate openvswitch-switch file to avoid restarts

The 16.10 release of the neutron-openvswitch charm changed the
file management strategy of /etc/default/openvswitch-switch
config file from managing the file when dpdk is enabled to always
managing the file. Additionally, the template file was changed
in the 16.10 release to modify the file header (commit 4463c334).
These two changes guarantee that the contents of the file will
change when upgrading the charm.

The changing file contents causes the openvswitch-switch service
to be restarted, which in turn causes a data plane outage. This
commit fixes that by migrating the /etc/default/openvswitch-switch
to be charm managed without restarting the openvswitch-switch
service.

The change will only attempt to migrate versions of the file
which were created before 16.10 by searching for a marker in the
rendered version of the file which was added in 16.10.

Change-Id: Icc0f326991be239b88a57292740473f501181ebb
Closes-Bug: #1712444

subject: my_ip should belong to internal-network rather than data-network
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-06-01 06:13:57.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'my_ip should belong to internal-network rather than data-network

We should define the following endpoint binding for nova-compute
application when enabling data-network for tenant network traffic
in overlay networks.

bindings:
  cloud-compute: *os-internal-space

Change-Id: I70b096fd709e5ec8d8a47d2d11f71ed3ea780c5d
Closes-Bug: #1686882
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2017-07-12 07:25:39.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "my_ip should belong to internal-network rather than data-network

When defining os-data-network=10.10.1.0/24, os-internal-network=10.12.1.0/24
and not defining os-data-space, private-address of nova-compute units
('network-get --primary-address cloud-compute' or 'unit-get private-address')
will be in 10.10.1.0/24 because now 10.10.1.0/24 and 10.12.1.0/24 are all in
internal-network.

nova-cloud-controller units can't collect public keys of nova-compute units
because they don't have NIC belonged to 10.10.1.0/24. This will lead to some
problems when resizing/migrating VM.

This problem can be fixed by defining os-internal-space for cloud-compute
because at this time private-address of nova-compute units will be in
10.12.1.0/24.

    bindings:
      cloud-compute: *os-internal-space

However, the nova-compute charm has an os-internal-network option, this should
also be referenced as a way to do this since not everybody uses spaces. This
patch is used to deliver this point, then we can fix this problem by:

juju config nova-compute os-internal-network='10.12.1.0/24'

Change-Id: I70b096fd709e5ec8d8a47d2d11f71ed3ea780c5d
Partial-Bug: #1686882
", 'number': 2}, {'created': '2017-07-12 08:00:04.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "my_ip should belong to internal-network rather than data-network

This problem can be fixed by defining os-internal-space for
cloud-compute because at this time private-address of nova-compute
units will be in 10.12.1.0/24.

    bindings:
      cloud-compute: *os-internal-space

However, the nova-compute charm has an os-internal-network option,
this should also be referenced as a way to do this since not
everybody uses spaces. This patch is used to deliver this point,
then we can fix this problem by running the following command:

juju config nova-compute os-internal-network='10.12.1.0/24'

Change-Id: I70b096fd709e5ec8d8a47d2d11f71ed3ea780c5d
Closes-Bug: 1686882
", 'number': 6}]
commit_message:
my_ip should belong to internal-network rather than data-network

When defining os-data-network=10.10.1.0/24,
os-internal-network=10.12.1.0/24 and not defining os-data-space,
private-address of nova-compute units will be in 10.10.1.0/24 because
now 10.10.1.0/24 and 10.12.1.0/24 are all in internal-network.

nova-cloud-controller units can't collect public keys of nova-compute
units because they don't have NIC belonged to 10.10.1.0/24. This will
lead to some problems when resizing/migrating VM.

This problem can be fixed by defining os-internal-space for
cloud-compute because at this time private-address of nova-compute
units will be in 10.12.1.0/24.

    bindings:
      cloud-compute: *os-internal-space

However, the nova-compute charm has an os-internal-network option,
this should also be referenced as a way to do this since not
everybody uses spaces. This patch is used to deliver this point,
then we can fix this problem by running the following command:

juju config nova-compute os-internal-network='10.12.1.0/24'

Change-Id: I70b096fd709e5ec8d8a47d2d11f71ed3ea780c5d
Closes-Bug: 1686882

commit_message:
Remove identity v3 change_password test

This commit removes the v3 change_password test because
it is currently getting skipped [0], because the policy
action does not exist in [1] and the API where it would
be enforced does not enforce it [2].

So the correct approach is to remove the test. Also renames
the class name to drop "Admin" substring as there is nothing
about this test class that requires admin credentials in any
way.

[0] http://logs.openstack.org/68/496068/4/check/gate-tempest-dsvm-patrole-admin-ubuntu-xenial/7069c22/console.html#_2017-08-23_00_50_18_947787
[1] https://github.com/openstack/keystone/blob/master/keystone/common/policies/user.py
[2] https://github.com/openstack/keystone/blob/4950c24bddaf98b79dfd9ee178ae1086cf48e322/keystone/identity/controllers.py#L279

Change-Id: I90496d3969b1ef69316a2254754622679bca54b5

This used to use a mutable default which would result in self.allow
always being a dict. Since allow is a public attribute, even though
keystoneauth1/identity/base.py does allow = allow or {} at the usage

", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Set self.allow to a dict if None is passed

This used to use a mutable default which would result in self.allow
always being a dict. Since allow is a public attribute, even though
keystoneauth1/identity/base.py does allow = allow or {} at the usage
place, we need to make sure it's a dict here too.

Change-Id: I388b8d7859744a1e7bd454641aaf98e4b6caa3b0

commit_message:
[TrivialFix] Move security group tests into correct test file

This commit moves security group tests currently in test_server_rbac
into test_security_groups_rbac as that is the logical place
for the tests. And this commit renames the deprecated security
groups test class to avoid a name conflict with the non-deprecated
test class.

Change-Id: Iae32d9bc7e22e39415e498e44f0da4f2711dc550

commit_message:
Change perms for the VM logs

When logs were under a directory without read permissions,
bifrost was not able to create the vm log files for centos/suse
and were not published.

Change-Id: Ifcc31c611edd34acb4fc3c1bb67bbe2a528d93cc

commit_message:
Add backward compatible connection attribute

Previously, IDL referenced to Connection with connection attribute.
Change I379448fd135a3bb2ac99709812b9f476c73923a7 switched to
ovsdb_connection attribute. This patch adds a property returning
ovsdb_connection for backward compatibility.

Change-Id: I60888baf053b3ff643757aa2cb3a7cd2c75e3cf6
Related-bug: #1712594

subject: Add functional test for rescheduling during a migration
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-08-24 18:23:35.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/functional/test_servers.py'], 'message': "Add functional test for rescheduling during a migration

This adds a functional test which recreates the bug where
the allocations on a destination node are not removed from
Placement before rescheduling during a cold migrate operation,
which is the same code flow as a resize even though resize
isn't explicitly tested here.

Change-Id: I1e3def1e98d0008240837eb1ad0eaa81a9b2d189
Related-Bug: #1712850
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Add functional test for rescheduling during a migration

This adds a functional test which recreates the bug where
the allocations on a destination node are not removed from
Placement before rescheduling during a cold migrate operation,
which is the same code flow as a resize even though resize
isn't explicitly tested here.

Change-Id: I1e3def1e98d0008240837eb1ad0eaa81a9b2d189
Related-Bug: #1712850

commit_message:
rehome extraroute api definition

This patch rehomes neutron's extraroute API definition into
neutron-lib as well as the associated exceptions into their respective
exception module.

UTs and a release note are also included.

Change-Id: I0425384d5fd6864f336bd7a5c9a5e70f2b3568ff

In v2 sample path, there are redundant files version-v2-show-response.json,

and version-v3-show-response.json, This patch is to remove the redundant

commit_message:
Api-ref: Reorganize volumes versions

In v2 sample path, there are redundant files version-v2-show-response.json,
in v3 sample path, there are redundant files version-v2-show-response.json
and version-v3-show-response.json, This patch is to remove the redundant
JSON file and reorganize volumes versions of v2 and v3

Change-Id: I3d9337cc94ad02138459742a7b84fe97bd09bb90

commit_message:
Use more specific asserts in test/unit/account tests

I changed asserts with more specific assert methods.
e.g.: from assertTrue(sth == None) to assertIsNone(*) or
assertTrue(isinstance(inst, type)) to assertIsInstace(inst, type) or
assertTrue(not sth) to assertFalse(sth).

The code gets more readable, and a better description will be shown on fail.

Change-Id: Icdbf3c63fe8dd6db1129023885655a9f7032d4a7

subject: [WIP] Avoid running pip_install twice
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-08-24 13:53:09.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': '[WIP] Avoid running pip_install twice

This patch is a test to see if we can avoid running the pip_install
role twice. It is applied as a role dependency, which causes it to
run during the initial RabbitMQ installation and during the upgrade
test. That causes delays in the gate.

Change-Id: I0bc0a10d1a9e19b424f0a330a5bee1b93cb4f261
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2017-08-24 14:22:25.000000000', 'files': ['tests/test-install-rabbitmq-server.yml', 'tests/test.yml', 'tests/test-vars.yml', 'meta/main.yml'], 'message': '[WIP] Avoid running pip_install twice

This patch is a test to see if we can avoid running the pip_install
role twice. It is applied as a role dependency, which causes it to
run during the initial RabbitMQ installation and during the upgrade
test. That causes delays in the gate.

Change-Id: I0bc0a10d1a9e19b424f0a330a5bee1b93cb4f261
', 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
[WIP] Avoid running pip_install twice

This patch is a test to see if we can avoid running the pip_install
role twice. It is applied as a role dependency, which causes it to
run during the initial RabbitMQ installation and during the upgrade
test. That causes delays in the gate.

Change-Id: I0bc0a10d1a9e19b424f0a330a5bee1b93cb4f261

commit_message:
Modify a little desc to satisfy the code

The method for attaching to update the status of the volume in the
DB is cinder.volume.api.reserve_volume in code and the method for
attaching to finalize the status of the volume and release the
resourece is cinder.volume.api.attach(self, context, volume,
instance_uuid, host_name, mountpoint, mode) in code.

Change-Id: I1af560d5840296d28d6f005b7758b6e75faa727e

subject: Fix cleaning of Cinder volumes in functional tests
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-08-23 21:39:24.000000000', 'files': ['shade/tests/functional/test_volume.py'], 'message': 'Fix cleaning of Cinder volumes in functional tests

There is some issue, probably with Cinder which cause sometimes
problem with removing of volumes. Such volumes stuck in "deleting"
state in Cinder.

This patch changes cleanup method from functional Cinder test that
it will not raise exception (and make test fails) if volumes will
not be cleaned properly.
In such case cleaning will try to delete volume once again with
"force=True" and will move forward if it also fails.

This change shouldn't cause any new problem with reached volumes quota
limits becasue before this patch such volumes were also not removed
properly.

Change-Id: I984f863b55b46fe6eba4a7ec31434ee4d2baa16f
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix cleaning of Cinder volumes in functional tests

There is some issue, probably with Cinder which cause sometimes
problem with removing of volumes. Such volumes stuck in "deleting"
state in Cinder.

This patch changes cleanup method from functional Cinder test that
it will not raise exception (and make test fails) if volumes will
not be cleaned properly.
In such case cleaning will try to delete volume once again with
"force=True" and will move forward if it also fails.

This change shouldn't cause any new problem with reached volumes quota
limits becasue before this patch such volumes were also not removed
properly.

Change-Id: I984f863b55b46fe6eba4a7ec31434ee4d2baa16f

commit_message:
Do not require OpenStack authentication to run osprofiler CLI

OpenStack authentication is needed by Ceilometer driver only
and is annoying when other drivers are used. The way we currently
verify os-parameters is conceptually wrong: first it covers only
subset of possible variations, second it differs from implementation
inside of python-ceilometerclient.

Change-Id: I3bbb7c47170064728790b22393f6071be3ace336
Closes-bug: 1653062

commit_message:
image-create-via-import fails with ValueError

CLI image-create-via-import fails with ValueError. The reason
is create command returns RequestIdWrapper object and not image
and response.

Further it fails with AttributeError: 'Namespace' object has
no attribute 'import_method'. The reason is do_import_image() call
requires 'import_method' as input which is not provided at the
moment.

Change-Id: Ic4c4d1f3c5d290b584840e8f9047fb53611a5748
Closes-bug: #1711511

commit_message:
VStorage: manage volume types for ploop and qcow2 volumes

VStorage driver can create volumes in multiple formats,
that are suitable for both virtual machines (qcow2) and
containers (ploop). To choose between volume formats the
vendor property vz:volume_format should be set in volume
type extra specs. Thus we need 2 volume types to support
both VMs and containers.

Change-Id: I7ffce9c16dfa524a3eac2e8d12ad7fd0b682eba6
Depends-On: Ib610e6f9c82259f9dd2db37178b24d964a38e20d
Signed-off-by: Pavel Glushchak <pglushchak@virtuozzo.com>

subject: Update discovery url normalization with catalog info
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-08-16 13:01:49.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Update discovery url normalization with catalog info

There's an unfortunately common deployment config issue where the
per-service version discovery document doesn't return scheme and netloc
properly. (Especially common with glance, as there was an actually
upstream bug in the version discovery documents until very recently)
Since up until now nobody has actually been doing version discovery
(all of the python-client libs skip it and cheat by appending strings
to URLs locally) it's a pervassive issue with existing clouds.

The workaround is to grab the scheme and netloc from the catalog url,
since the service_url is a resource on the endpoint described by the
catalog_url, and since the catalog_url has to be correct or else nothing
works. Do this in the url normalization so that it persists in the
cache, and so that things like endpoint_override are not affected.

The need for the workaround and the description of it are documented in
the API-SIG spec on consuming version discovery.

Change-Id: I29102e08998b662db8136bee32217532a316f263

commit_message:
Update discovery url normalization with catalog info

There's an unfortunately common deployment config issue where the
per-service version discovery document doesn't return scheme and netloc
properly. (Especially common with glance, as there was an actually
upstream bug in the version discovery documents until very recently)
Since up until now nobody has actually been doing version discovery
(all of the python-client libs skip it and cheat by appending strings
to URLs locally) it's a pervassive issue with existing clouds.

The workaround is to grab the scheme and netloc from the catalog url,
since the service_url is a resource on the endpoint described by the
catalog_url, and since the catalog_url has to be correct or else nothing
works. Do this in the url normalization so that it persists in the
cache, and so that things like endpoint_override are not affected.

The need for the workaround and the description of it are documented in
the API-SIG spec on consuming version discovery.

Needed-By: I78019717cdee79cab43b0d11e737327aa281fd03
Change-Id: I29102e08998b662db8136bee32217532a316f263

commit_message:
Add method to get the api major version

Similar to get_endpoint, which knows it doesn't need full endpoint_data,
if a user just wants to know what major version the discovery process
wound up with, there are cases in which we do not need to fetch
discovery documents. Provide an API call that a user can use when this
is the information they need to avoid them having to play games with
discover_versions settings.

Change-Id: I204a45d1d139a90176bcc2ef8d46decd09b2cd5b

commit_message:
Allow filtering network ports by fixed_ips

The patch in [1] introduced filtering network ports by fixed-ip in the
openstackclient, but it doesn't really work because the filter isn't
accepted in the sdk.

Add that option and add an unit test for the filter list.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/388575

Change-Id: I6cbb7f1aaff8ad12234f68ddb3fe564c556ece54
Closes-Bug: 1712527

subject: Add options for easily booting from a new volume
revisions:
[{'created': '2016-04-01 02:01:59.000000000', 'files': ['openstackclient/tests/compute/v2/test_server.py', 'openstackclient/compute/v2/server.py'], 'message': "Add options for easily booting from a new volume

Previously, the only option to boot from a volume using OpenStack
client consisted of using the --block-device-mapping option. This
option requires that the volume already exists prior running the
server create command as per the v1 specification of block device
mapping. Since the addition of the v2 block device mapping format
the compute API can create the volume from a source type such as
an image or a snapshot, and attach it to use it as the boot disk
for the new instance, all during the create request.

Instead of simply exposing the block device mapping v2 format
directly, this exposes a set of options that allows the user to
specify a boot-disk-type which maps to the destination type in
the v2 format, and it the source type is assume to always be either
an image or snapshot. For more complex block device mapping, then
it's suggested to use the --block-device-mapping option.

Exposing the block device mapping v2 format direclty
can be cumbersome to use since permitted values cannot be easily
discovered and does not indicate which are required and which are
optional without out of band knowledge (docs).

Change-Id: Ie041e7a7722ef320ae3da61eac8e836a4a262c00
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Add options for easily booting from a new volume

Previously, the only option to boot from a volume using OpenStack
client consisted of using the --block-device-mapping option. This
option requires that the volume already exists prior running the
server create command as per the v1 specification of block device
mapping. Since the addition of the v2 block device mapping format
the compute API can create the volume from a source type such as
an image or a snapshot, and attach it to use it as the boot disk
for the new instance, all during the create request.

Instead of simply exposing the block device mapping v2 format
directly, this exposes a set of options that allows the user to
specify a boot-disk-type which maps to the destination type in
the v2 format, and it the source type is assume to always be either
an image or snapshot. For more complex block device mapping, then
it's suggested to use the --block-device-mapping option.

Exposing the block device mapping v2 format direclty
can be cumbersome to use since permitted values cannot be easily
discovered and does not indicate which are required and which are
optional without out of band knowledge (docs).

Change-Id: Ie041e7a7722ef320ae3da61eac8e836a4a262c00

subject: Migrate "image show" command to osc from glanceclient.
revisions:
[{'created': '2016-06-17 10:36:35.000000000', 'files': ['openstackclient/image/client.py', 'releasenotes/notes/bp-migrate-glanceclient-to-osc-4a195d904c26e157.yaml', 'openstackclient/image/v2/image.py', 'functional/tests/image/v2/test_image.py'], 'message': 'Migrate "image show" command to osc from glanceclient.

This patch add a new "image show" command which is supported by SDK.
The old "image show" command still can be used because this new command
is a beta command and needs to be used with "--os-beta-command" option.

The reasons of using "--os-beta-command" for this command are as belows:
1.Using "--os-beta-command" option can retaining the old command, we'd
better retain the old command which is depend on glanceclient until the
SDK support is good enough.
2.When we migrate a image command, we should insure others image command
can be used and were not be influenced. Using "--os-beta-command" can
meeting this requirement.

Partially-Implements: blueprint migrate-glanceclient-to-osc
Change-Id: Ief52766a5976ca06558bb5be0aa90fa91f034f7d
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Migrate "image show" command to osc from glanceclient.

This patch add a new "image show" command which is supported by SDK.
The old "image show" command still can be used because this new command
is a beta command and needs to be used with "--os-beta-command" option.

The reasons of using "--os-beta-command" for this command are as belows:
1.Using "--os-beta-command" option can retaining the old command, we'd
better retain the old command which is depend on glanceclient until the
SDK support is good enough.
2.When we migrate a image command, we should insure others image command
can be used and were not be influenced. Using "--os-beta-command" can
meeting this requirement.

Partially-Implements: blueprint migrate-glanceclient-to-osc
Change-Id: Ief52766a5976ca06558bb5be0aa90fa91f034f7d

commit_message:
Format external gateway info output

This patch improves the external gateway info output
format in "router show", "router list" and
"router create" command.

Before this patch, the output was:
| external_gateway_info   | enable_snat='True', external_fixed_ips='[{u'subnet_id': u'1f96272b-dbb3-44d3-abdb-267ccb3b2673', u'ip_address': u'172.24.4.2'}, {u'subnet_id': u'40b03ae3-0b89-4719-aa9d-             |
|                         | d4770e9adf19', u'ip_address': u'2001:db8::1'}]', network_id='cc6e2d7b-5eb5-4eda-8a4a-11a1864a47b0'

After this patch, it will become:
| external_gateway_info   | enable_snat='True'                                                         |
|                         | network_id='cc6e2d7b-5eb5-4eda-8a4a-11a1864a47b0'                          |
|                         | external_fixed_ips:                                                        |
|                         | ip_address='172.24.4.2', subnet_id='1f96272b-dbb3-44d3-abdb-267ccb3b2673'  |
|                         | ip_address='2001:db8::1', subnet_id='40b03ae3-0b89-4719-aa9d-d4770e9adf19' |

Change-Id: Idecb4ebbd40bfaca788c593c0ae9eaa74eae04fc
Partial-bug: #1519503

+----------------+--------------------------------------+
| admin_state_up | UP                                   |
| id             | 17f3ab2d-ecba-4e36-b52c-218852e3c89d |
| name           | bbb                                  |
+----------------+--------------------------------------+

commit_message:
Do not print "headers" when creating network resource

network.create_xxx() in sdk will return an object with an attribute
named "headers" with some info which means nothing to users, like this:

# openstack network create bbb
+----------------+--------------------------------------+
| Field          | Value                                |
+----------------+--------------------------------------+
| admin_state_up | UP                                   |
| headers        |                                      |
| id             | 17f3ab2d-ecba-4e36-b52c-218852e3c89d |
| name           | bbb                                  |
+----------------+--------------------------------------+

So filter it out in get_columns(). After this patch, it will be like
this:

# openstack network create bbb
+----------------+--------------------------------------+
| Field          | Value                                |
+----------------+--------------------------------------+
| admin_state_up | UP                                   |
| id             | 17f3ab2d-ecba-4e36-b52c-218852e3c89d |
| name           | bbb                                  |
+----------------+--------------------------------------+

Change-Id: Ic90606a35b457f68068a7dbd989e421eb62bf1f4

commit_message:
Add extensions support for os port commands

Added support for extensions in port commands.
Operations on extensions such as Security Groups,
Allowed Address Pairs, QoS and Extra DHCP Opts
now supported.

commit_message:
Abstract a helper to add --project option

There is a add_project_domain_option_to_parser() in
openstackclient/identity/common.py which is widely
used in OSC. --project option is similar. So we can
add a similar helper to add --project option to a
parser.

This patch only uses this helper in network because
they are all the same. In other files, there are
also --project options with different help message.
Will deal with them in the future.

Change-Id: I73d137d061fcfd538263db04bc1b76b26fa31fe9

commit_message:
Feature: Add option to disable root_disk in flavor

This feature adds the possibility to define a flavor,
that does not create ephemeral root_disk on the hypervisor;
If root disk size is set to None, users are "forced" to create
a bootable volume to launch an instance from that flavor.

APIImpact
DocImpact

Change-Id: I99bbf9b29100813609a62aa925600bc6bd4ba9c0
Implements: blueprint flavor-root-disk-none

commit_message:
Added option --is-domain to create project in keystone

This patch adds the option --is-domain to create keystone project
as a domain in keystone. Use the option --is-domain at
"openstack project create" to create a project as domain:

openstack project create --is-domain <project_name>

Without the --is-domain keystone will create a normal project.

Related-Bug: #1487600

Change-Id: I15934d572aea7821d23fc067ae214a6956fea361

commit_message:
Add auth example

examples/osc_auth.py is the auth flow currently used by OSC.  This will
form the basis for experimenting and validating additional authentication
processes.

It is not expected to be used in tests or in fact be a long-lived
member of examples/.  It is being checked into the repo as a way
of having a common distribution and basis for experimentation.

Change-Id: I2b40c75c729d76b03f081f5527bd5e318ac7a95a

commit_message:
Add support for service-names

Some services need to override service name. For instance, long-time
Rackspace customers can wind up with 2 compute services in their catalog
due to legacy slicehost.

* image list and image show are wired to cache the returned data; they
  use the same cache but the saved data is still all wrong and an image

', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Add CacheManager

This is an early exercise for a CacheManager (similar to ClientManager)
that contains all of the various object cache descriptors.  This is mostly
to validate this approach for handling the object cache instances.

* image list and image show are wired to cache the returned data; they
  use the same cache but the saved data is still all wrong and an image
  cached from image list is not found by image show.  The first problem is
  that image list uses our internal API and image show still using glanceclient
  and caching an Image resource.  To be dealt with later...

Change-Id: I3661101e9d98a47259f878788bb7a5bbd3374aca

commit_message:
Log begin/end of log collection

The console log has output from the log collection,
but it's not clear that the output is part of a test
or something after the test.

This makes it clearer that the output between the
begin/end are related to log collection.

Change-Id: Iba374d89fa5c11f8690af73e87804cb29cb7fc9e
(cherry picked from commit 4bda4b9ea0bb4db63604d14fb44316b32c3f27b3)

commit_message:
Add object-rsync-timeout option

Adds the rsync_timeout option to to object-server.conf, so we can adjust
it away from the default of 900s.

If there are a number of large partitions needing replication,
occasionally one needs to adjust the timeout in order to allow the rsync
to complete rather than timeout and retry.

Note: Also includes change to amulet tests for validating the workers,
which is needed for the updated worker calculation count.

Change-Id: I2d895741cb0528836a675deb6399005a5bf59ab5
Depends-On: Ia250f45b4f734f5a25c1deebbf6d7fa5303b6ad9
Closes-bug: 1702039
(cherry picked from commit 18419a87c50f798b1468e7265b30836f70eba1d1)

commit_message:
Dual Stack VIPs

Enable dual stack IPv4 and IPv6 VIPs on the same interface.
HAProxy always listens on both IPv4 and IPv6 allowing connectivity
on either protocol.

charm-helpers sync for HAProxy template changes.

Change-Id: Icf210cd1f3aa836dd8b36edbbce73b3b2af68da7

commit_message:
Add lxml to tempest venv

Some tempest tests, including those for keystone, require lxml.
This patch ensure lxml exists in the tempest venv.

The backport was updated to avoid a merge conflict in the list of
tempest_pip_packages.

Change-Id: I0ad60d881d81edbcdd61c3c2cb474f6e73a69499
(cherry picked from commit b7c60f512b4944d39a52bf4b828aeadadd224698)

commit_message:
Un-use 'scope' attribute for wizard modal service

'scope' attribute for wizard modal service is deprecated.
It will be removed on Queens.
So this patch changes not to use 'scope' attribute.

Change-Id: Id716858468fcb05dcce9160809308b4213da923c
Closes-Bug: #1647995

subject: Recon's get_diskusage and get_unmounted return all devs.
revisions:
[{'created': '2016-07-29 09:32:44.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Recon's get_diskusage and get_unmounted return all devs.

If account, container and object are on one server but use different devs,
then for example diskusage on account returns also object-only disks.

Change-Id: I78793328587a021436fdbddf8ff9731cb6182745
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2017-08-24 14:28:54.000000000', 'files': ['swift/common/middleware/recon.py', 'test/unit/common/middleware/test_recon.py', 'swift/cli/recon.py'], 'message': "Recon's get_diskusage and get_unmounted return all devs.

If account, container and object are on one server but use different devs,
then for example diskusage on account returns also object-only disks.

Change-Id: I78793328587a021436fdbddf8ff9731cb6182745
", 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Recon's get_diskusage and get_unmounted return all devs.

If account, container and object are on one server but use different devs,
then for example diskusage on account returns also object-only disks.

Change-Id: I78793328587a021436fdbddf8ff9731cb6182745

subject: Run sign-artifacts role on executor
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-08-24 18:15:32.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/python-tarball/post.yaml'], 'message': 'Run sign-artifacts role on executor

I incorrectly assumed we delegated_to: localhost inside the role.  So
limit this to localhost to ensure it is run on the executor.

Change-Id: I39904d39131a576d679d0daa4dfd82ee485d0367
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Run sign-artifacts role on executor

I incorrectly assumed we delegated_to: localhost inside the role.  So
limit this to localhost to ensure it is run on the executor.

Change-Id: I39904d39131a576d679d0daa4dfd82ee485d0367
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add a reminder about novaclient versions for queens

I know this is unusual but an artefact of the release/requirements
process means that we need to release 9.2.0 from pike.  So we don't
inadvertently release 9.2.0 from queens add a warning/reminder.

Change-Id: I0fcddd04d68d7417e42eb2aeb296610d7aeb0d34

subject: Use resource collector for the fencing -> stonith ordering
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-08-23 15:55:37.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/profile/base/pacemaker.pp'], 'message': "Use resource collector for the fencing -> stonith ordering

Change Ifef08033043a4cc90a6261e962d2fdecdf275650 moved the stonith
property definition to the pacemaker_master node. This means that the
Class['tripleo::fencing'] -> Class['pacemaker::stonith'] ordering
breaks on non-boostrap pacemaker nodes because the pacemaker::stonith
property is not defined there any longer.

Let's fix this by simply using a resource collector and set the ordering
on that instead of adding yet anoth if statement. Ordering on
enablement of stonith is actually more correct formally.

Tested this on a broken setup successfully.

Closes-Bug: #1712605
Change-Id: I616d340bdf75da9d9eb8b83b2e804dff3d07d58e
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Use resource collector for the fencing -> stonith ordering

Change Ifef08033043a4cc90a6261e962d2fdecdf275650 moved the stonith
property definition to the pacemaker_master node. This means that the
Class['tripleo::fencing'] -> Class['pacemaker::stonith'] ordering
breaks on non-boostrap pacemaker nodes because the pacemaker::stonith
property is not defined there any longer.

Let's fix this by simply using a resource collector and set the ordering
on that instead of adding yet anoth if statement. Ordering on
enablement of stonith is actually more correct formally.

Tested this on a broken setup successfully.

Closes-Bug: #1712605
Change-Id: I616d340bdf75da9d9eb8b83b2e804dff3d07d58e

commit_message:
Move ovsdb_connection definition to Backend

ovsdb_connection is used in Backend, but defined only in
sub-classes. By moving the definiton to Backend, subclasses
don't need to define it even if they don't use it, and
Backend doesn't assume it's defined

Change-Id: I2e08fca268c4749e757a07fc6b335ae0fc283a75

commit_message:
Move common definition into common layer

move common definition into common layer, as dependency patches
like I64ad387ec7b532e9dbc791f683a005587825ff61 plan to use the
definitions of the schema, this patch moves these definitions
as common ones

commit_message:
Docker: Enable TLS in the internal network for libvirt

Bind mounts the necessary certs and keys to enable live migrations
using TLS.

bp tls-via-certmonger-containers

commit_message:
Remove VMware driver _get_vm_ref_from_uuid method

VMware driver defines _get_vm_ref_from_uuid and _get_vm_ref_from_name
which have the same implementation.

This change removes _get_vm_ref_from_uuid to avoid code duplication and
updates _get_vm_ref_from_name docstring to integrate details from
_get_vm_ref_from_uuid docstring.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: I952332528d69ef0c9b5959fdb0c3bb56bb4f19c0

subject: How about not logging errors every time we shelve offload?
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-08-24 13:05:34.000000000', 'files': ['nova/compute/resource_tracker.py'], 'message': 'How about not logging errors every time we shelve offload?

The delete_allocation_for_instance method does not return
anything and "if not None" is always True, so we're always
logging an error when we shelve offload an instance, which
is not the most fun thing in the world.

This was probably caused by some confusion with how
remove_provider_from_instance_allocation works which does
return a boolean result.

Change-Id: I30b716b0649f6d367ea747149da5c5f921ae19c5
Closes-Bug: #1712689
(cherry picked from commit e208cbb1f122b948af91a8d11c0f45dcec5bbc76)
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
How about not logging errors every time we shelve offload?

The delete_allocation_for_instance method does not return
anything and "if not None" is always True, so we're always
logging an error when we shelve offload an instance, which
is not the most fun thing in the world.

This was probably caused by some confusion with how
remove_provider_from_instance_allocation works which does
return a boolean result.

Change-Id: I30b716b0649f6d367ea747149da5c5f921ae19c5
Closes-Bug: #1712689
(cherry picked from commit e208cbb1f122b948af91a8d11c0f45dcec5bbc76)

commit_message:
Fix no_proxy evaluation for Swarm clusters

At the moment, no_proxy variable is evaluated separately for docker
daemon and for swarm-manager container running in docker. Evaluated
value for swarm-manager is not getting into cloud-init script, because
$NODE_PROXY token is getting replaced by Heat str_replace function.
This commit is intended to unify NO_PROXY evaluation and also fix the
issue with swarm-manager.

Related-Bug: #1647815
Related-Bug: #1632698
Related-Bug: #1660562
Change-Id: I336024265008b6cae308bf7b614476b71b81fa01

commit_message:
Reduce package set to install via bindep

The build-essential meta-package is a very large
set. We only need gcc and the others listed in
order to support pip and Ansible. The fewer we
install via bindep, the greater the chance we
have of figuring out what's missing from each
role's distro package list.

Change-Id: I97f068eb1368fccb61be900625e5b5dcbf77d527
(cherry picked from commit 078e50f7ef416ef99b11b7afe9958509ff9c0e4f)

commit_message:
Reduce package set to install via bindep

The build-essential meta-package is a very large
set. We only need gcc and the others listed in
order to support pip and Ansible. The fewer we
install via bindep, the greater the chance we
have of figuring out what's missing from each
role's distro package list.

Change-Id: I97f068eb1368fccb61be900625e5b5dcbf77d527
(cherry picked from commit 078e50f7ef416ef99b11b7afe9958509ff9c0e4f)

subject: hardware offload support for openvswitch
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-03-22 12:11:43.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'HW offload support for openvswitch

In Kernel 4.8 we introduced TC HW offloads framework
for SR-IOV VF which allow to configure the NIC [1].

These OVS patches [2] allow to use the TC
framework to offload ovs datapath rules.

This patch allow ODL mech driver to bind direct (SR-IOV) port.

[1] http://netdevconf.org/1.2/papers/efraim-gerlitz-sriov-ovs-final.pdf
[2] https://patchwork.ozlabs.org/patch/738176/

commit_message:
hardware offload support for openvswitch

In Kernel 4.12 we introduced Traffic Control (TC see [1]) hardware offloads
framework for SR-IOV VFs which allows us to configure the NIC [2].
Subsequent OVS patches [3] allows us to use the TC framework
to offload OVS datapath rules. This feature is supported in OVS 2.8.0.
netvirt patch [4] is also necessary to make this work with ODL netvirt
backend.

This patch allow ODL mech driver to bind direct (SR-IOV) port.

[1] http://netdevconf.org/1.2/papers/efraim-gerlitz-sriov-ovs-final.pdf
[2] https://patchwork.ozlabs.org/patch/738176/
[3] https://mail.openvswitch.org/pipermail/ovs-dev/2017-April/330606.html
[4] https://git.opendaylight.org/gerrit/#/c/60259/

Change-Id: Id4a44d7a128fafc889416077eb88d504dcc9ee0f

subject: 51-hosts fails if given lots of changes
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-04-07 08:50:46.000000000', 'files': ['elements/hosts/os-refresh-config/configure.d/51-hosts'], 'message': '51-hosts fails if given lots of changes

The issue is how awk is used to update hosts files.  When
os-apply-config produces sufficiently large amounts of lines
to be added (or ensure in) hosts files, awk will error out.
To work around it, instead use sed, and reconstruct the
host file(s) to ensure the entries between the comment delimeters
of "# HEAT_HOSTS_START" and "# HEAT_HOSTS_END" are swapped with
the new entries.

Also get rid of blank lines produced by os-apply-config

Partial-Bug: #1674732
Change-Id: Ibe0a9f6ec10d55750e3b0e16301236141f988d69
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
51-hosts fails if given lots of changes

The issue is how awk is used to update hosts files.  When
os-apply-config produces sufficiently large amounts of lines
to be added (or ensure in) hosts files, awk will error out.
To work around it, instead use sed, and reconstruct the
host file(s) to ensure the entries between the comment delimeters
of "# HEAT_HOSTS_START" and "# HEAT_HOSTS_END" are swapped with
the new entries.

Also get rid of blank lines produced by os-apply-config

Partial-Bug: #1674732
Change-Id: Ibe0a9f6ec10d55750e3b0e16301236141f988d69

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 7787, 'name': 'Kevin Benton', 'email': 'kevin@benton.pub', 'username': 'blak111'}, {'_account_id': 8655, 'name': 'Jakub Libosvar', 'email': 'libosvar@redhat.com', 'username': 'jlibosva'}, {'_account_id': 9656, 'name': 'Ihar Hrachyshka', 'email': 'ihrachys@redhat.com', 'username': 'ihrachys'}, {'_account_id': 9732, 'name': 'Mellanox CI', 'email': 'mlnx-openstack-ci@dev.mellanox.co.il', 'username': 'mellanox', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10257, 'name': 'Sridhar Gaddam', 'email': 'sgaddam@redhat.com', 'username': 'sridhargaddam'}, {'_account_id': 16376, 'name': 'Intel NFV CI', 'email': 'openstack-nfv-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'intel-nfv-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-08-23 11:03:58.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/cmd/sanity/checks.py'], 'message': 'Fix test_keepalived_ipv6_support for Keepalived v1.2.20

In commit [1] (some explanation in [2] ) VRRP initialisation is enhanced
to read source IP address(to use when sending VRRP packets) from the
HA interface or from keepalived config("unicast_src_ip" parameter).
If it is unable to find IP address, VRRP initialisation will fail with
error "Cannot find an IP address to use for interface".

In the test, we set vrrp->family to AF_INET by setting vip to
169.254.0.1/24 through config, but not providing source IPv4 address(i.e
no 'unicast_src_ip' option or no IP on HA interface), making the test
to fail with [1]. To fix that, we set the IP address on HA interface.

Note: Commit [1] is added in Keepalived version 1.2.20.
Tested the fix on both Keepalived v1.2.19 and Keepalived v1.2.20.

[1] https://github.com/acassen/keepalived/commit/37488e57
[2] https://github.com/acassen/keepalived/issues/445

Closes-bug: #1712388
Change-Id: I260c0e6810ed54c93f93621afa6ab13855ef2428
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix test_keepalived_ipv6_support for Keepalived v1.2.20

In commit [1] (some explanation in [2] ) VRRP initialisation is enhanced
to read source IP address(to use when sending VRRP packets) from the
HA interface or from keepalived config("unicast_src_ip" parameter).
If it is unable to find IP address, VRRP initialisation will fail with
error "Cannot find an IP address to use for interface".

In the test, we set vrrp->family to AF_INET by setting vip to
169.254.0.1/24 through config, but not providing source IPv4 address(i.e
no 'unicast_src_ip' option or no IP on HA interface), making the test
to fail with [1]. To fix that, we set the IP address on HA interface.

Note: Commit [1] is added in Keepalived version 1.2.20.
Tested the fix on both Keepalived v1.2.19 and Keepalived v1.2.20.

[1] https://github.com/acassen/keepalived/commit/37488e57
[2] https://github.com/acassen/keepalived/issues/445

Closes-bug: #1712388
Change-Id: I260c0e6810ed54c93f93621afa6ab13855ef2428

commit_message:
Fix default qos policy when creating network

In _create_network_policy(), policy object is passed into _get_policy_obj()
although it expects to be passed policy id. This patch passes policy id
instead of policy object and adds a unit test and API tests.

Change-Id: Ic4c755c54d93d7ca3312b432b7c1e6770f25c359
Closes-bug: #1712278

commit_message:
Update policy on rule addition/removal

The problem was addressed by calling rpc_update_firewall_policy
after insert/remove firewall rule.

Added unit tests.

Also added a covering scenario test, implemented
insert_firewall_rule_in_policy/ remove_firewall_rule_from_policy
in tempest tester and performed minor cleanup of related code
(unused parameter removal, commented code). Enforced validation
of firewall_rule_id for rule insert/remove.

Co-Authored-By: Elena Ezhova <eezhova@mirantis.com>
Change-Id: I58eda38f70e5ed5b8867fbef05b7c9ccd7155f47
Closes-Bug: #1711391

When deploying containerized and enable_pacemaker is set to true, make
sure to include the docker-ha.yaml file.

Also this cleans up the `when` conditional, which allows to remove the
docker.yaml file from network_args, which prevents network_args from
unwantedly overriding docker-ha.yaml contents from container_args.

Partial-Bug: #1712070
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Containerized deployment with pacemaker via OOOQ

When deploying containerized and enable_pacemaker is set to true, make
sure to include the docker-ha.yaml file.

Also this cleans up the `when` conditional, which allows to remove the
docker.yaml file from network_args, which prevents network_args from
unwantedly overriding docker-ha.yaml contents from container_args.

Change-Id: I5f28d2f784b9cd381ba370c9635300fe0ed79845
Partial-Bug: #1712070

subject: Delete instance allocations when the instance is deleted
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-08-24 03:25:34.000000000', 'files': ['nova/compute/manager.py', 'nova/tests/functional/test_servers.py'], 'message': 'Delete instance allocations when the instance is deleted

In a deployment that still has Ocata computes, the resource
tracker will delete the allocations for an instance when it
is deleted, but in an all-Pike+ computes deployment, the
allocations will only be removed for a deleted instance
during the update_available_resource periodic task.

The capacity on the node should be freed as soon as the
instance is deleted, like when we shelve offload an
instance, so this does that.

The ServerMovingTests functional tests were glossing over
this by forcing the run of the update_available_resource
periodic task code after the instance was deleted but
before checking the allocations were gone from Placement.
So this change removes that part of the tests to show
this fixes the problem.

Change-Id: I0f57b4ba8e4c3931b70bd737de5b7c8ae47f033d
Closes-Bug: #1712684
(cherry picked from commit d6de0e57c21472b99cbe71ec62b3967ef7282dec)
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Delete instance allocations when the instance is deleted

In a deployment that still has Ocata computes, the resource
tracker will delete the allocations for an instance when it
is deleted, but in an all-Pike+ computes deployment, the
allocations will only be removed for a deleted instance
during the update_available_resource periodic task.

The capacity on the node should be freed as soon as the
instance is deleted, like when we shelve offload an
instance, so this does that.

The ServerMovingTests functional tests were glossing over
this by forcing the run of the update_available_resource
periodic task code after the instance was deleted but
before checking the allocations were gone from Placement.
So this change removes that part of the tests to show
this fixes the problem.

Change-Id: I0f57b4ba8e4c3931b70bd737de5b7c8ae47f033d
Closes-Bug: #1712684
(cherry picked from commit d6de0e57c21472b99cbe71ec62b3967ef7282dec)

commit_message:
Sign artifacts before we release them

Using the new sign-artifacts role, sign the artifacts before we release
them in the release job.

Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

commit_message:
functional: Fix reference to ovsdb connection

Change I379448fd135a3bb2ac99709812b9f476c73923a7 replaced connection
attribute of IDL to ovsdb_connection. After updating upper constraints
to newer ovsdbapp version, we no longer have connection attribute.

Change-Id: I6f060fff4df7323a3877f56cb1fa586a22d16670
Closes-bug: #1712594

commit_message:
Prevent check haproxy script from generating meaningless logs

Redirect the logs into /dev/null. Otherwise, it will be collected by
docker engine, which is meaningless.

Change-Id: I7d1d4cac61e62144bc11c26e7b00fc21037eb8d1
Closes-Bug: #1708097

subject: add local_settings template for Ocata
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-08-24 09:14:35.000000000', 'files': ['templates/ocata/local_settings.py'], 'message': 'add local_settings template for Ocata

ceilometer_policy.json file was removed as a part of
20ea82b9efe78516286c4b35c5dc644b296b4313 horizon commit made before the
Ocata release due to ceilometer API deprecation.

Having this in a template for Ocata results in an error on first login
via a given http server.

Therefore, this change adds another template for Ocata+ which does not
contain a reference to that file in POLICY_FILES.

Change-Id: I3320622684c3185db45094563f277d4c7ce0694d
Closes-Bug: 1712617
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
add local_settings template for Ocata

ceilometer_policy.json file was removed as a part of
20ea82b9efe78516286c4b35c5dc644b296b4313 horizon commit made before the
Ocata release due to ceilometer API deprecation.

Having this in a template for Ocata results in an error on first login
via a given http server.

Therefore, this change adds another template for Ocata+ which does not
contain a reference to that file in POLICY_FILES.

Change-Id: I3320622684c3185db45094563f277d4c7ce0694d
Closes-Bug: 1712617

Change-Id: Idd10735c764717cf711f62b3243d39d8c8ed263f
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Install docker python module with pip

The docker-py python module is now called docker and has an
incompatible api. Running latest kolla-ansible with docker-py
will throw an error like this:
AttributeError: 'module' object has no attribute 'APIClient'

Change-Id: Idd10735c764717cf711f62b3243d39d8c8ed263f

commit_message:
nova-manage: Deprecate 'cell' commands

The Cells v1 feature is deprecated, meaning we can also deprecate the
respective commands in nova-manage. Do this.

Change-Id: I6db62a16272c74215944db164830515b774f5085
(cherry picked from commit dcef0aa666a05e0053c928dd0fca0354f0f61f72)

To ensure project imports are placed after third party import,

', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
flake8-import-order: Ensure to place project imports last

To ensure project imports are placed after third party import,
we need to specify application-import-names.
Previously flake8-import-check checked only standard imports or not.

Change-Id: Iad7afa456cec7cf5b44955f1ea03c593a4c0e426

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-07-04 05:18:28.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Implement environment audit reports

Add notifications about environment events that are required for
tracking. These are AMQP notifications and oslo.messaging library
is used for sending them.

The follow event types are provided:

 - environment.deploy.end
   This event is issued on successful finish of environment deployment,
   provides general information about environment and also deployment
   start and finish times

 - environment.delete.end
   This event is issued on environment delete (and abandon as well)

 - environment.exists
   This is a period event, it's issued for every existing environment
   that has successful deployments

There are 2 new configuration options controlling these notifications:

 - stats.env_audit_period
   Controls how often to send environment.exists notification, by
   it's once per hour (60 minutes)

 - env_audit_enabled
   Allows to completely disable environment-related notifications. By
   default notifications are enabled.

Change-Id: I8dee2456b7ccab7c0c167aa21abb9710959ebb30
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2017-07-04 08:37:59.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Implement environment audit reports

There are 2 new configuration options controlling these notifications:

 - stats.env_audit_period
   Controls how often to send environment.exists notification, by
   it's once per hour (60 minutes)

 - env_audit_enabled
   Allows to completely disable environment-related notifications. By
   default notifications are enabled.

commit_message:
Implement environment audit reports

Add notifications about environment events that are required for
tracking. These are AMQP notifications and oslo.messaging library
is used for sending them.

The follow event types are provided:

 - environment.deploy.end
   This event is issued on successful finish of environment deployment,
   provides general information about environment and also deployment
   start and finish times

 - environment.delete.end
   This event is issued on environment delete (and abandon as well)

 - environment.exists
   This is a period event, it's issued for every existing environment
   that has successful deployments

There are 2 new configuration options controlling these notifications:

 - stats.env_audit_period
   Controls how often to send environment.exists notification, by
   it's once per hour (60 minutes)

 - env_audit_enabled
   Allows to completely disable environment-related notifications. By
   default notifications are enabled.

Change-Id: I8dee2456b7ccab7c0c167aa21abb9710959ebb30

subject: Enable F811, F821
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-08-23 19:04:19.000000000', 'files': ['cinderclient/v3/volumes.py', 'cinderclient/tests/unit/test_utils.py', 'cinderclient/v3/messages.py', 'tox.ini', 'cinderclient/tests/unit/fake_actions_module.py'], 'message': 'Enable F811, F821

F811 is a little noisy with api_versions.wraps()
decorated methods, but opting to disable it in these
cases seems better than missing problems in the rest
of the code.

Change-Id: I9c46938ab2a442e55f96b5ab6c119c4475afaecd
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Enable F811, F821

F811 is a little noisy with api_versions.wraps()
decorated methods, but opting to disable it in these
cases seems better than missing problems in the rest
of the code.

Change-Id: I9c46938ab2a442e55f96b5ab6c119c4475afaecd

service in a container.

Related-Bug: #1704161
Change-Id: Icc7cf75fcdc6bae3058a91ae7fb57fa3424246f0
(cherry picked from commit aeb7f57fb7b467189340102f991a7ff61000d040)

commit_message:
Test containerised cinder-volume

In order to validate that cinder-volume in a
container works on a regular basis, the ceph
scenario test is setup to implement the
service in a container.

Related-Bug: #1704161
Change-Id: Icc7cf75fcdc6bae3058a91ae7fb57fa3424246f0
(cherry picked from commit aeb7f57fb7b467189340102f991a7ff61000d040)

commit_message:
Ceph incremental backup fails with AttributeError

Ceph incremental backup uses _snap_exists() to check if a snapshot
exists. Here while checking if the name of the snapshot matches the
one passed in the method, it uses snap.name where snap is actually
a dictionary. Therefore, the correct line should be to use snap['name']
instead so that there is no AttributeError.

Change-Id: I611da9c6f04b8834a018e02bea833530ac4a615f
Closes-Bug: #1701080

commit_message:
Do not use test.get_service_list()

Currently 'network' service is always True in test.get_service_list()
S check for the same is not much of use.
Also Tempest is moving the get_service_list from test.py to utils.
- Ibd52153d00b8e60fb8c89e38d94e358ddc787251

Till that movement is done, let's comment the usage of get_service_list
and if needed to check 'network' service availability, then get_service_list
can be used from new location.

Change-Id: I8edd8da695698db03a752dcfedbd290facfa8fca

subject: Fix iSCSI volume attachment over RDMA transport
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-08-23 14:34:57.000000000', 'files': ['os_brick/initiator/connectors/iscsi.py', 'os_brick/tests/initiator/connectors/test_iser.py'], 'message': "Fix iSCSI volume attachment over RDMA transport

Recent changes assumed 'tcp:' prefix to iscsi sessions,
and that broke the session status discovery for RDMA
connections. in this change we add the 'iser:' transport
prefix to the os-brick functions, to fix volumes attach
over RDMA.

Closes-bug: #1710599
Change-Id: I27b30dafcf488ebd125917e1924c828e3bdf3a99
(cherry picked from commit af2f60f9bab271ba26d4d1e8f15e0d1ce7f1ccec)
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix iSCSI volume attachment over RDMA transport

Recent changes assumed 'tcp:' prefix to iscsi sessions,
and that broke the session status discovery for RDMA
connections. in this change we add the 'iser:' transport
prefix to the os-brick functions, to fix volumes attach
over RDMA.

Closes-bug: #1710599
Change-Id: I27b30dafcf488ebd125917e1924c828e3bdf3a99
(cherry picked from commit af2f60f9bab271ba26d4d1e8f15e0d1ce7f1ccec)

commit_message:
Add fset030 for OVN with containerized oc

featureset028 was added recently to have OVN baremetal services. This patch
adds featureset030 for containerized OVN services.

Partial-bug: #1699085
Change-Id: Idc027e41d0e98eebe134be4c0909c4165eb8e83d

Test: Fail jobs if resources are added or removed

This fails tests if either cleanup doesn't do its job and there are
resources left hanging around; or if cleanup is a little too
aggressive and deletes stuff it oughtn't.

Change-Id: I388db48ca56dd8d5d247bf09a46872f1b107a7ca

subject: Liveness script An alternative to talking to the monitors: consult the unix-domain sockets instead of the monitors.
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-08-24 14:38:25.000000000', 'files': ['ceph/templates/ceph-liveness.sh'], 'message': 'Liveness script
An alternative to talking to the monitors: consult the unix-domain sockets instead of the monitors.

Exits 0 iff there is one or more active admin sockets and all daemons
claim to be active per "ceph status".  Exits 1 otherwise.  Note that
this isn't perfect: we don't know how many daemons SHOULD be active,
so if only a subset is live and the others have no sockets (yet?),
we'll still claim the pod is ready.

Change-Id: I4de03a1eb7a2d920a8269f6e4e88d2895b8c390c
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Liveness script
An alternative to talking to the monitors: consult the unix-domain sockets instead of the monitors.

Exits 0 iff there is one or more active admin sockets and all daemons
claim to be active per "ceph status".  Exits 1 otherwise.  Note that
this isn't perfect: we don't know how many daemons SHOULD be active,
so if only a subset is live and the others have no sockets (yet?),
we'll still claim the pod is ready.

Change-Id: I4de03a1eb7a2d920a8269f6e4e88d2895b8c390c

commit_message:
Fix MariaDB apt package pinning

The variables in vars are only loaded when the include_vars
task is run, which is after meta-dependencies are processed.

This patch ensures that the pinning is properly applied when
the meta-dependent role is executed.

Closes-Bug: #1712315
Change-Id: Ibc7766e96e478250b5e7d4788bb56dace974d25f
(cherry picked from commit c24d590d8acf808134e846f36a84fb23e88bd4ef)

commit_message:
Update percona xtrabackup to 2.3.5

MariaDB 10.0.32 released on Aug 17 which, when configured
to use xtrabackup for the SST, requires percona xtrabackup
version 2.3.5 or higher.

This patches the package used to the minimum version to
try to minimise the change implemented.

Co-Authored-By: Matt Thompson <mattt@defunct.ca>
Change-Id: Iddea53ffcc4b60438a87a2271bdbbf53f99ad33d

The delete_allocation_for_instance method does not return

is not the most fun thing in the world.

This was probably caused by some confusion with how

commit_message:
How about not logging errors every time we shelve offload?

The delete_allocation_for_instance method does not return
anything and "if not None" is always True, so we're always
logging an error when we shelve offload an instance, which
is not the most fun thing in the world.

This was probably caused by some confusion with how
remove_provider_from_instance_allocation works which does
return a boolean result.

Change-Id: I30b716b0649f6d367ea747149da5c5f921ae19c5
Closes-Bug: #1712689

The console log has output from the log collection,

subject: Only report errors when collecting logs
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-08-24 10:49:24.000000000', 'files': ['test-log-collect.sh'], 'message': 'Only report errors when collecting logs

Currently there are a lot of log collection lines
showing which files are not copied because they
are symlinks. They take up an awful lot of room
in the console log and are not very useful.

This patch sets the --quiet flag so that only
errors show up in the console log.

Change-Id: I2e03bf3f0a5b1aff3c4cc6a4e4803d172dabde65
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Only report errors when collecting logs

Currently there are a lot of log collection lines
showing which files are not copied because they
are symlinks. They take up an awful lot of room
in the console log and are not very useful.

This patch sets the --quiet flag so that only
errors show up in the console log.

Change-Id: I2e03bf3f0a5b1aff3c4cc6a4e4803d172dabde65

The build-essential meta-package is a very large

Change-Id: I97f068eb1368fccb61be900625e5b5dcbf77d527
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Reduce package set to install via bindep

The build-essential meta-package is a very large
set. We only need gcc and the others listed in
order to support pip and Ansible. The fewer we
install via bindep, the greater the chance we
have of figuring out what's missing from each
role's distro package list.

Change-Id: I97f068eb1368fccb61be900625e5b5dcbf77d527

handled by rsync.
